Personalized implants

The shape of the oral cavity varies from individual to individual in size, appearance, etc.
Everyone is different, so it's important to have a systematic checkup to ensure that
Make it right for you.

01 / 05

Digital analytics implants

3D and CT scans are taken before implant surgery,
Run the simulation on your computer.
The results were then used to create plastic guides for implant surgery. 
Insert the guide into the patient's mouth and proceed with the pre-planned surgery.
02 / 05

Bone Graft Implants

Gum recession is so severe that there is insufficient bone to support the implant.
Bone grafting, such as artificial bone, is followed by implant placement to create a
You can make it tighter.
03 / 05

Health Insurance Implants

Insurance backed by the National Health Service
Seniors age 65 and older with health insurance can use the
We want you to feel comfortable with your implant placement.
Implant treatment covered by insurance.
04 / 05

Implant immediately after tooth extraction

Tooth extraction and implant placement at the same time.
It can reduce bone loss and prevent gum atrophy.
It's less painful and allows you to get back to your normal routine.
You can also shorten the duration of your treatment.
This will be done based on the condition of your teeth.
05 / 05

What are wisdom teeth?

These are the third largest molars at the back of the mouth.There are usually two on the upper jaw and two on the lower jaw.
They all have four wisdom teeth.

But in modern times, we have smaller jawbones and the
As advances in dental prosthetics have reduced the rate of molar loss, the
Often, teeth that should be erupted do not emerge due to space issues and become buried in the jawbone.

Wisdom teeth
Symptoms by type

What is TMJ disorder?

The TMJ is the joint that sits between the jawbone and the skull, connecting the two bones.
It acts as the center of gravity for all jaw movements and is supported by muscles and ligaments.
The disc between the jaw joints acts as a cushion between bone and bone.
Muscles, ligaments, disks, and jaw bones work together to open, masticate, and swallow,
It's responsible for activities like speaking, and many factors can affect its functionality.
The abnormality is called TMJ disorder.

Top 3 Jaw Joint Symptoms

Aperture restrictions
When your mouth is fully open
45 to 55 mm for men and 40 to 45 mm for women.
The normal opening.
40 mm opening with mouth comfortably open
or less, it is determined to be an aperture restriction.
Joint Noise
With a 'click' or 'tingle' in your jaw
Expressive simple articulation,
with sounds like "zippy zippy" or "square square".
They are categorized by the vocalizations they represent.
Pain
The trigger point for the pain is the jaw joint.
is the most common, followed by
of the pectoralis major, temporalis minor, and sternocleidomastoid muscles.
They appear in this order
Jaw joint disorders can cause migraines or
Other symptoms include stiffness in the neck and shoulders.

Treating cavities

Everyone's teeth are different in size, shape, and wear.
Because of this, a customized treatment plan for individual oral conditions
You want to make sure you save as much of your precious natural teeth as possible.

Types of cavities

1. enamel caries

Decay of the enamel, the outer surface of the tooth.
It's almost painless.

2. dentin caries

To the dentin inside the enamel.
If the cavity has progressed and is hot or
If you eat cold food
You experience symptoms of chills.

3. pulpitis caries

The inflammation extends to the nerves inside the dentin.
progressed to extreme pain and
It becomes unbearable.

4. pulp necrosis

If the tissue inside the tooth is
Necrotic, peri-root
Due to inflammation
The bones will gradually disappear.

Inlay treatment

ah Rotten areasand then remove any gold or Resin or ceramicfor the missing tooth circle and
The same shape can be created with the and paste it with glue to replicate the function and form of a decayed tooth.
Restorative care.
[Gold Inlay].
Gold has long been used to replace decayed teeth because it is biocompatible, with physical properties that most closely resemble natural teeth.
It can be used even if the tooth has a large area of damage and can be used for a long time.
 
[Resin Inlay].
It is less hard than gold, but has better adhesion and is less expensive.
It has similar advantages to traditional tooth color.
 
[Ceramic inlay].
It's stronger than resin, so it's relatively stable, and the
They are aesthetically pleasing because they are similar in color to existing teeth.

Crown treatment

Crown treatmentafter all cavities are removed.
Full toothwhich overwrites the Treating cavities.
Depending on the filling material, they are divided into gold crowns, PFM, zirconia crowns, etc.
[gold tooth].
A crown that covers a tooth using the most biocompatible gold available.
 
[occlusal surface metal]
The outside is ceramic, the same color as your natural teeth.
The inside uses an alloy or gold alloy to support the impact on the crown.
 
[zirconia].
The most popular crown type these days is
By increasing strength compared to traditional aesthetic materials,
The crown is the strongest of the tooth-colored materials.

Aesthetic Prosthetics

Prosthodontics is used when a tooth is damaged or missing.
 
Replacing with a prostheticby allowing the original tooth to function
That is, Authoring features as well as Restore pronunciation and aestheticsThis is the treatment you order.

Aesthetic Prosthetic Materials

1. laminate

  • Aesthetically, it's a simple way to reshape and whiten teeth.
  • The most aesthetically pleasing of all materials.
  • Minimize the amount of deletion of teeth.
  • The color and shape are the same as natural teeth.

2. all-ceramic

  • Similar in strength and hardness to natural teeth.
  • Less gum discoloration after treatment.
  • Less plaque deposition due to better fit of the prosthesis.
  • Aesthetically pleasing.

3. zirconia

  • It is also suitable for molar prosthodontics and implants due to its high strength.
  • They are almost identical in color to natural teeth.
  • Conductivity is low.
  • Biocompatible.

Teeth whitening

Tooth Corruptionwithout giving the tooth a Brighten with the formula
Tooth Restore original coloror Whitening treatmentwhich is the cure.

External causes of tooth discoloration

by beverages or foods that contain coloring, such as coffee, wine, cola, etc.
Discoloration of the teeth.
Smoking is another common external factor.

Internal causes of tooth discoloration

A darkening and yellowing of the internal structure of the tooth.
Excessive fluoride intake in early childhood or prenatal exposure to
Taking tetracycline antibiotics can cause discoloration of the teeth.
